decks.notes: The main focus of this Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Thoughtseize and Skyclave Apparition while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Recruiter of the Guard and Stoneforge Mystic. Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while cards like Solitude provide removal options. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through blinking creatures like Flickerwisp. The mana base is set up to support a variety of colors needed for the deck's spells and abilities.

This deck aims to win the game quickly by casting as many spells as possible on the first turn to put the opponent on the back foot. The key strategy is to fill the graveyard with creatures as quickly as possible, then use Dread Return to bring Thassa's Oracle onto the battlefield to win the game. The deck includes a mix of cheap creatures, mana acceleration, and disruption to help achieve this game plan efficiently. The goal is to combo off before the opponent has a chance to establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruption spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher alongside Chalice of the Void to control the board, the deck aims to close out games quickly with its large threats. The deck also includes ramp options like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple to accelerate its game plan. Overall, the Eldrazi Aggro deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game to secure victories.

This control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and mana base while generating advantage through graveyard recursion and land destruction. The deck aims to grind out the opponent by stripping away their resources with cards like Smallpox, Thoughtseize, and Wasteland, while also establishing a strong board presence with cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. By controlling the game and resource management, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The main focus of this Bant Control deck is to control the game through countering spells, card draw, and removal spells. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Daze to counter threats, while also utilizing cards like Swords to Plowshares for creature removal. Additionally, it includes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find answers and maintain card advantage. With a mix of powerful threats such as Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Murktide Regent, the deck looks to establish board presence and close out the game.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Doomsday combo with cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to set up a winning Thassa's Oracle win condition. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and interact with the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the combo with fetch lands and dual lands. Dauthi Voidwalker and Thundertrap Trainer provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing your own strategy. The goal is to win the game in a single, decisive turn with the Doomsday combo.

This deck focuses on using lands as control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up a win condition through Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation, Life from the Loam, and Exploration to maximize land synergies and generate advantage. Boseiju, Who Endures protects key spells from countermagic, while cards like Ghost Quarter and Wasteland disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes utility lands like Maze of Ith and Karakas for additional protection. Overall, the deck aims to control the game's pace and outvalue the opponent through land manipulation.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively ramp up mana and use efficient creatures like Wight of the Reliquary, Scythecat Cub, and Badgermole Cub to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Endurance to control the opponent's game plan. With strong mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent and disrupt their strategy, while also having access to powerful lands like Gaea's Cradle and Wasteland to further control the game.

This deck utilizes the Cephalid Illusionist combo with Nomads en-Kor to fill your graveyard with creatures like Narcomoeba, enabling you to win with a Dread Return on Thassa's Oracle or Murktide Regent. It also includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo pieces and protecting them while controlling the board, leading to a powerful and efficient win condition.

This combo-infect deck focuses on efficiently pumping up small creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf to quickly deal lethal infect damage to the opponent. It includes various ways to protect its creatures with counterspells like Force of Will, as well as utilizing pump spells like Invigorate and Berserk to surprise the opponent and secure a win. The deck also includes card draw and library manipulation to ensure consistent draws and find the key pieces needed to execute the combo. With a mix of aggression and control, this deck aims to win through infect damage before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using spells like Careful Study and Thoughtseize. By utilizing cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead, the deck can then bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for a swift victory. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect its game plan. Overall, the deck aims to leverage the combo potential of reanimation to overwhelm opponents and secure a win.

The main concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruption spells. The deck focuses on generating early pressure with creatures like Ocelot Pride and Guide of Souls while using cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland to control the board. Additionally, cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provide additional synergy and versatility to the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces of Show and Tell to put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play for free. The deck includes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Stock Up to dig for combo pieces, while also running disruption like Force of Will and Veil of Summer to protect the combo from opposing interaction. With the ability to cheat expensive creatures into play early and overwhelm the opponent, this deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and close out the game.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo pieces of Show and Tell, Omniscience, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to cheat out the big Eldrazi creature and win the game. It utilizes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Intuition to find the necessary pieces while also running cards like Force of Will and Veil of Summer for protection. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition as fast as possible, making it a powerful and competitive combo deck in the Legacy format.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures and countermagic. The deck aims to control the board by using spells like Fatal Push, Hymn to Tourach, and Thoughtseize to remove threats from the opponent's hand and field. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Stifle to counter spells and slow down the opponent. Finally, the deck looks to close out the game quickly with aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to utilize powerful creatures such as Guide of Souls, Voice of Victory, and Amped Raptor to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The inclusion of Goblin Bombardment adds additional reach and removal options, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides support and buffs for the team. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Static Prison and Karakas to control the opponent's board state. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of fetch lands and utility lands like Sunbaked Canyon and Wasteland.
